metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10044 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The aio_mount function in fs/aio.c in the Linux kernel before 4.7.7 does not properly restrict execute access, which makes it easier for local users to bypass intended SELinux W^X policy restrictions, and consequently gain privileges, via an io_setup system call. It was discovered that the asynchronous I/O (aio) subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly set permissions on aio memory mappings in some situations. An attacker could use this to more easily exploit other vulnerabilities.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-132-generic - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-lowlatency - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-3.13.0-132-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-132.181
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-132-generic - 3.13.0-132.181
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-132.181').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-132.181').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1').
